titleStmt.title: Ivan Milecz on measures taken against Jews from Galicia in 1941

div.p: The original transcription is not available.

Since it has been discovered that the Jews from Galicia are trying to get to Romania through secret roads, the leader of the state, general Antonescu, gave a strict order of banning Jews from Galicia from entering Romania. He also ordered that those Jews who have already crossed the border or those who will try to trespass it are to be arrested as spies and executed on the spot. The border officers and employees who will allow the Jews across the border to Romania, or who do not show sufficient precaution to prevent the influx of these Jews from coming, will be considered their accomplices and will be shot.

The order sounds very strict and I think it is mostly to daunt people, since especially after the experience with Jews during the war with Russia (see my report no. 1796 of a political report no. 139 from July 1st 1941), no more regard is given to the Jews here and the actions towards them are drastic. (See my report no. 2019 of a political report no. 166 from July 18th 1941 )
Made in 4 copies, 3 of them for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and 1 copy to be stored within the records.
